intro: Ditaxis guatemalensis var. barrancana, commonly known as the Guatemalan ditaxis, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, producing a distinctive yellowish-green color with prominent orange stamens. This variety is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often growing in sunny, open habitats.
